results.title: Chemical evolution
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Origin of Life”.
Evidence supporting evolution of life in the primordial sea is the basis for the film’s content. Actual footage of scientific investigations is featured. These include: Russian biochemist - AI Oparin; Dr Stanley Miller and Dr Cyril Ponnamperuma. We also see a miniature amino acid analyser and other complex analytical apparatus at NASA’s Ames Research Centre.

results.title: Deciding to organize
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Sherr Klein and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Organizing for Power”.
Produced as a part of the Challenge for Change Program, this series examines Saul Alinsky’s method of organizing communities into effective action units based on participation democracy. A group of concerned citizens from Dayton, Ohio, consult Alinsky on means of creating an effective organization.

results.title: Ordinary extraordinary stories
results.brief_description: Ordinary Extraordinary stories features a selection of digital stories produced as part of ACMI digital storytelling public workshop program. results.title: The Little Frenchman
results.brief_description: Roger was a widower with no living relatives or close friends. His life experiences placed him in both world wars and post war migration. This is his story.

results.title: Orchestra!
results.creator_credit: Initial (GB), Jonathan Hewes and Declan Lowney
results.brief_description: This series is an entertaining and informative introduction to the symphony orchestra. Featuring Maestro George Solti and the musical talent and humour of Dudley Moore, the three volumes trace the development of the various sections of the orchestra from the time of Bach and Handel to today. The theme of the four parts of the orchestra is established by breaking down a piece of music into its four constituent parts - strings, brass, percussion and woodwind.

results.title: The Making of 'Orchestra!': Piano. The conductor
results.creator_credit: Declan Lowney, Jonathan Lewes and Initial (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Orchestra!”.
This volume of the “Orchestra!” series explores the making of the series. It examines the role of the piano as a solo instrument within an orchestra and the role of the conductor from learning the score through interpretation, the metronome and rehearsal technique.
results.description:

results.title: Lower strings; Brass; Percussion
results.creator_credit: Declan Lowney, Jonathan Hewes and Initial (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Orchestra!”.
This volume of the “Orchestra!” series examines the role of the lower strings: the cello and the double bass. Examines the effect of the invention of the valve on brass instruments and the role of percussion instruments in the orchestra.

results.title: Introduction to Orchestra!: Upper strings. Woodwind
results.creator_credit: Declan Lowney, Jonathan Hewes and Initial (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Orchestra!”.
This volume of the “Orchestra!” series provides an introduction to the methods and objectives of the series. It also examines the role of the the upper string instruments, violin and viola and the early work of Bach and Handel. It also examines the woodwind section focussing on the oboe and the use of a double reed.
